title.narrative: 7.3 LOCAL COUNCILS, TRADITIONAL LEADERS,

description.narrative: 7.3 Local Councils, Traditional Leaders, Communities and Implementing partners have the capacity to develop and implement equitable child-friendly plans for effective decentralised service delivery by end 2019., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Public Finance And Local Governance. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7.0 Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data by 2019.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.3 Local Councils, Traditional Leaders, Communities and Implementing partners have the capacity to develop and implementequitable child-friendly plans for effective decentralised service delivery by end 2019.

description.narrative: The Medium-Term National Development Plan was devolved to the districts and council level to engender ownership at the grassroots so that councils and communities can develop and implement child friendly plans. To support the decentralization and local chieftaincy reforms as detailed in the Government's New Direction and the Medium-Term National Development Plan, UNICEF's new Country Programme was developed with a focus on building decentralized capacity particularly in the areas of district-level planning and budgeting processes. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020

target.value: 2019:16 district councils with reliable mechanism for child/adolescent participation
